author: chunqingchen
body:
Similar to issue #4663

Only this time it repros on windows and affects daily appveyor.

TEST FAILURES
Description: Should have download link about Universal C runtime that is reachable
Name:        Windows Installer.Universal C Runtime Download Link.Should have download link about Universal C runtime that is reachable
message:
Error 404 - Not FoundWarning: This site requires the use of scripts, which your browser does not currently allow.See how to enable scripts

Should we set the tests to be pending until we can stabilize the result?

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @TravisEz13 It looks like the `Get-Content` test was set to pending, but not the `Invoke-WebRequest` test which is causing the 404. https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/6.0.0-beta.6-4971

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body:
@chunqingchen : The reason why the `Get-Content` test failed this time was because [this](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/commit/d5521beb18f5269a1cd4e4bcb122ed65f45a05db) commit removed code that had to be re-written but did not remove/disable the test. But it was OK that you set the test to 'Pending' at the moment, because the pending PR #4745  brings back an improved implementation and it will remove the 'Pending' attribute as part of it.
@TravisEz13 : The `Invoke-WebRequest` tests should never fail because they basically check that the download links are still working, therefore this might be rather an issue with the CI environment. Maybe simply using the `-UseBasicParsing` switch for `Invoke-WebRequest` could make it work better?

title: WindowsInstaller.Tests.ps1 failed on windows
